articles.description: More than 300,000 people may have given up smoking to reduce the risk to their health should they fall ill with the coronavirus, a survey has indicated.Public Heath England issued a warning last month
articles.content:
More than 300,000 people may have given up smoking to reduce the risk to their health should they fall ill with the coronavirus, a survey has indicated.
Public Heath England issued a warning last month that smokers were putting themselves at much greater ris… [+440 chars]

articles.author: Rachel Dale
articles.title: Going into hospital with coronavirus saved my life after docs found I had severe heart problem - The Sun
articles.content:
A COVID-19 survivor has told how the virus saved her life after doctors discovered she was also suffering from a debilitating heart condition.
Intensive care specialist medics told Angela Schlegel, 36, she had an autoimmune disease that left the organ under … [+2368 chars]

articles.author: April Curtin
articles.title: When will lockdown end in London and what will our new normal look like? - MyLondon
articles.description: Life in the capital will look very different post-lockdown
articles.content:
It's the question that is on every single person's mind - when will it end?
We've been in lockdown for six weeks now, and we've all had to make a range of sacrifices.
Whether this be economic or social sacrifices, sacrifices to help others, or dealing with … [+17556 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Clark
articles.title: Another patient dies after being treated for coronavirus at Nortumberland's hospital trust - Northumberland Gazette
articles.description: Four more coronavirus-related deaths have been confirmed in Northumberland’s hospital trust.
articles.content:
New figures from NHS England today show 164 people who died in the Northumbria trusts hospitals tested positive for the disease.
Across the North Easts seven hospital trusts, there have now been 1,115 coronavirus-related deaths

articles.content:
